article.name: How to Assign the Exchange Administrator Role to the PhishER Blocklist Application
article.title: How to Assign the Exchange Administrator Role to the PhishER Blocklist Application
article.body:
The PhishER Blocklist feature integrates with your Microsoft 365 mail server to help you to prevent malicious or spam emails from reaching your users’ inboxes. After you enable the PhishER Blocklist, you will need to assign the Exchange Administrator role to the PhishER Blocklist application to authenticate it. You can assign the role in your Microsoft Entra or Microsoft Azure console.

Note:If you enable the Global Blocklist, you will need to assign the Exchange Administrator role to the Global Blocklist application to authenticate it.

Assigning the Role in Microsoft Entra

To assign the Exchange Administrator role to the application in Microsoft Entra, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to the Microsoft Entra admin center using your admin credentials. You must have at least a Privileged Authentication Administrator role.
  2. Navigate to Microsoft Entra ID > Identity > Show more > Roles & admins > Roles & admins to open the Roles and administrators | All roles window.
  3. Click the Exchange Administrator role name to open the Exchange Administrator | Assignments window.
  4. Click Add assignments to open the Add assignments window.
  5. Under the Membership subtab’s Select member(s) section, click No member selected to open the Select a member pop-up window.
  6. In the pop-up window that opens, enter "PhishER Blocklist" in the search bar to display the PhishER Blocklist application.
  7. Select the check box next to the PhishER Blocklist application and click Select to return to the Add assignments window. The application will display under the Selected member(s) section.
    Note:Depending on your version of Microsoft Entra, you may see different settings for steps 5-7. If the Add assignments pop-up window displays a search bar, enter "PhishER Blocklist" in the search bar. Select the check box next to the PhishER Blocklist application and click Add to return to the Add assignments window. Skip the remaining steps.
  8. Under the Setting subtab’s Assignment type section, select Active.
  9. Under the Maximum allowed assignment duration is permanent section, select the Permanently assigned check box.
  10. In the Enter justification field, enter a reason for your selected duration.
  11. Click Assign.

Assigning the Role in Microsoft Azure

To assign the Exchange Administrator role to the application in Microsoft Azure, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to the Microsoft Portal.Azure admin center using your admin credentials. You must have at least a Privileged Authentication Administrator role.
  2. In the Azure Services Dashboard that opens, click Microsoft Entra ID roles and administrators to open the All roles window. If the icon is not displayed, enter "Microsoft Entra ID roles and administrators" in the search bar.
  3. Click the Exchange Administrator role name to open the Exchange Administrator | Assignments window.
  4. Click Add assignments to open the Add assignments window.
  5. Under the Membership subtab’s Select member(s) section, click No member selected to open the Select a member pop-up window.
  6. In the pop-up window that opens, enter "PhishER Blocklist" in the search bar to display the PhishER Blocklist application.
  7. Select the check box next to the PhishER Blocklist application and click Select to return to the Add assignments window. The application will display under the Selected member(s) section.
    Note:Depending on your version of Microsoft Azure, you may see different settings for steps 5-7. If the Add assignments pop-up window displays a search bar, enter "PhishER Blocklist" in the search bar. Select the check box next to the PhishER Blocklist application and click Add to return to the Add assignments window. Skip the remaining steps.
  8. Under the Setting subtab’s Assignment type section, select Active.
  9. Under the Maximum allowed assignment duration is permanent section, select the Permanently assigned check box.
  10. In the Enter justification field, enter a reason for your selected duration.
  11. Click Assign.

This image displays the **Roles and administrators | All roles** section within the **Microsoft Entra admin center**.

**Context and Navigation:**
*   The application header confirms the context as the **Microsoft Entra admin center**.
*   The active view is `Home > Roles and administrators | All roles` for the tenant "Knowbe4 - Microsoft Entra ID for workforce."
*   The left navigation pane shows **Roles & admins** as the selected major category, with the sub-item **Roles & admins** highlighted, indicating the current page view.

**Main Content Area (Roles List):**
*   **Toolbar:** The view includes action buttons for role management: `+ New custom role`, `Delete custom role`, `Download assignments`, `Refresh`, and controls for `Preview features` and `Got feedback?`.
*   **PIM Banner:** A prominent blue informational banner encourages using PIM (Privileged Identity Management) for "just-in-time access."
*   **Role List Table:** The table lists administrative roles, their descriptions, assignment counts, and role types.
    *   **Focus Row:** The row for **Exchange Administrator** is specifically highlighted. Its description states: "Can manage all aspects of the Exchange product." It currently has **6** assignments and a role type of **Built-in**.
    *   **Attributes:** Certain roles (e.g., Directory Writers, Global Administrator, Global Reader) are labeled with a **PRIVILEGED** tag.
    *   **Custom Roles:** One visible role, *exchange admin2 Copy*, is explicitly marked with the **Custom** role type.
